author: Oblivionatingstud

text:
@TamedShadow Yes, I am aware of that, but I am not going to use an improper vocabulary to describe my platforming skills to make them seem more probable or sound more modest, I am a fucking BAWS at platforming games, everything from Mega Man, Mega Man x, Donkey Kong Country, Actraiser, Super Mario Galaxy, everything, and I've SLAIN it time and time again.
When people watch me play some of my golden classics they go like "-whoa, are you cheating or something?".
author: megaDudeMegaDude

text: @megaDudeMegaDude When people use overly exaggerated words like ''godly'', one tends to sway towards suspicion.
author: Schmidt Herman

text:
@8bitsMagicSock Not to be rude, but assuming from your reply you must SUCK at thinking! I fucking BLAZED through this game! Don't worry about my platforming skills, I'll have you know that I am godly at these kind of games. 
Can't you read my comments? I said that overall, I found it a good game with great atmosphere, but playing it was slow, and the inventory system does not help either, I found it to be the games greatest weakness, but I am not saying it's bad! DKC is awesome.

text: Wow, this is a really haunting song for an SNES game. Seldom have I felt such despair in any videogame theme, yet alone 16-bit. I'll have to try this game out.
author: masterplusmargarita

text: @Mindasphyxiation I fought him and won ... with savestates. But he was with savestates too very hard^^
author: Griflion

text:
This sounds terribly silly, but when playing this level as a young child, I met my first encounter with mortality... I'm talking about that pendulous skeleton hanging out of one of the windows of that building located at the beginning of the level.
Even today, I still get chills seeing that whilst hearing this sorrowful melody.
author: Czarsaturn

text: isnt the first image of the music the column equal to a magic the gathering card, "Howling mine"?
author: Victor

text:
@fantasyunderfire218 

really? man I can´t believe that, I mean, this game isn´t so fucking hard, I beat that dark demon first try, ok I used all potions ;-) Still I don´t unterstand what the people back then thought...Maybe DD doesn´t play in the league as Metroid, but in my opinion it´s the only game aside Metroid for the SNES that creates something like a special atmosphere during the entire game thanks to epic music, bossfights and plot. And this is only 16bit!!!
author: FreshDeus

text: What happened to the good games......
author: Charlymaumushi

text: I hope this game is put into the Wii shop channel. I would buy it. This game has a awesome soundtrack and challenging gameplay. Sure it may be old cause its a Snes game but still it deserves to be given good reviews. All in All I give Demons Crest a 9/10 IMO.
author: Mecha-Art

text:
Despite everything about it being good; it was just WAY to hard back then and still is. 
This is why it generated negative sales. And Nostalgia junkies really can't fault people for doing so because..admit it...when a game is exceedingly difficult than it really should be, you're gonna get pissed.
And face it, you have other things you need to do with your lifeo ther than bust your ass trying to beat an impossible game in one sitting....right?

author: Lou Santos

text: why do they return the game? is very good in all aspects
author: SuperFalconZX

text:
I remember seeing this game in one of Nintendo Power's Top 100 Games lists a while back... it stood out as, if I remember correctly, the only game in Nintendo history to generate negative sales numbers in a week - due to more people returning the game that week than actually buying it.  Which is nutso.

A cool game, though, regardless.

text: I don't think I've played this one, but great song. I've played Super Ghouls and Ghost all the way to the end (twice, and killed the final boss) as a kid though.
